Key Match Events: Real Madrid forward Rodrygo scored the only goal as Brazil secured a 1-0 victory over Ecuador.
Rodrygo's deflected 30th-minute strike was enough to secure all three points for Brazil.
Despite dominating possession for long periods, Brazil created little in the way of clear-cut scoring chances, with only three shots on goal.
Post-Match Reflections: Brazil boosted their lacklustre 2026 World Cup qualifying campaign with this victory.
Brazil moved up to fourth place in the South American qualifying standings with 10 points from seven games.
Brazil have struggled in recent international tournaments, losing in the quarter-finals of the 2022 World Cup and failing to progress past the last eight at this year's Copa America.
